revised_title: Discovery of a New Plasmodium in Antelopes and its Characteristics
tldr: The authors discovered a new species of plasmodium in antelopes in Nyasaland. They observed and described the unique characteristics of the parasite, including its large size, unusual gametocyte arrangement, and the way it affects the red blood cells. This discovery contributes to the understanding of malaria in animals and may have implications for human malaria research.
